item.title: Repeat failure risk: prune or fell tree., 6th October
item.description:
Location: ///milky.handle.dull The whitebeam in front of numbers 39 & 41 is a mature highway tree on a school-route footway overhanging the carriageway/parking. As a result of Storm Amy, a sizeable primary limb (≈80–120 mm dia., ≈2–3 m long) has recently failed into the highway/parking bay, damaging a vehicle. (photo attached). The crown is biased toward the road, historic pruning wounds are present, and the tree is growing in a compacted verge with limited rooting volume and possible interaction with water services. Given the predictable, high-occupancy targets (school start/finish and continuous kerbside parking), further limb loss is a foreseeable risk. Recent failure points to reduced residual strength and declining structural reliability. On proportionality and duty-of-care grounds, and applying ALARP, this tree has reached the end of its functional life for this location. Please consider remediation before the high-wind season

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitebeam Avenue, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street security lighting still not fixed, 6th October
item.description:
The security lighting which covers the rear of these houses has not been working for several weeks. This makes the backs of the houses vulnerable to criminal activity which feels unsafe for residents. The light is positioned between No2 and No 4 Esmeralda Road. Please can it be fixed immediately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Esmeralda Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Between 28 and 26 Kenilworth Road, 6th October
item.description:
The tree has really grown in size, and is almost touching the roofs of both no26 & no28. There is visible root damage to the pavement and the property owners are scared the tree will soon cause subsidence as it is thirsty and growing towards our properties. Please pollard the tree before it gets bigger and causes more problems.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kenilworth Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
